revised_title: Stanley Peat: A Pioneering Chemist and Educator
tldr: Stanley Peat was a prominent chemist and educator who made significant contributions to the understanding of carbohydrate chemistry. Born in 1902, Peat overcame early health challenges and taught himself to read and write before attending school. He excelled in science and won a scholarship to Rutherford College, where he studied chemistry and physics. Peat continued his education at Armstrong College, earning a B.Sc. with First Class Honours in Chemistry. He then joined Professor W.N. Haworth's research laboratory, where he made important discoveries in the ring structure of sugars. Peat later became a lecturer in biochemistry at the University of Birmingham Medical School, where he continued his research and teaching career. Throughout his life, Peat was known for his deep humanity, sense of humor, and intellectual curiosity, which he brought to his work and personal life.
